page.title: 06Stodmarsh Church.
page.content: {St. Mary's Church}is small and very old and can seat up to sixty people. It has a small square wooden{ {bell turret}which has a shingled spire. There are two{bells}which are believed to be some of the oldest in Kent. Near the door are some crusaders' marks. The newest part of the church is the{north wall}which fell down a hundred years ago. The beams are oak, and they are original which means they have been up since the church was first built. Behind the curtain it is very damp because of the{high water table;}never _theless the rest of the church is clean, bright and cheerful. When Gregory Holdstock died recently they could not bury him in Stodmarsh with his family because the grave would have filled up with water. The last grave was dug in the 1930's.
